appendix.title: Directory of RTC and VoIP Service Providers
appendix.para: This is a directory of companies offering RTC and PSTN services over the Internet.
Not all these services are fully based on open source software or open standards. Some of them use a combination of open and proprietary elements to provide a solution.

sect1.title: apidaze
sect1.para: Integrate telephony and WebRTC services into existing web sites and mobile apps.

sect1.title: Circuit
sect1.para: Fully managed hosted collaboration service with WebRTC and app-based access and a developer API.

sect1.title: Gradwell
sect1.para: SIP trunking and hosted PBX service based in the UK.

sect1.title: RestComm
sect1.para: A cloud-based service for deploying and operating telephony-based applications for the web and mobile. Applications can interact with RestComm using REST techniques.

sect1.title: Tropo
sect1.para: Hosted PBX service that can be extensively customized with scripting or manipulated from other systems making calls to a REST API. Scripts can be developed in a variety of languages and then deployed into the Tropo server.

sect1.title: Truphone
sect1.para: Next generation global mobile network with IP connectivity.

sect1.title: Voxbone
sect1.para: Inbound SIP trunking service with global coverage. REST-based provisioning API.

sect1.title: Voxhub
sect1.para: UK-based turnkey telephone service for business.

sect1.title: VoxImplant
sect1.para: A SIP trunking service, an SDK for embedding the service into arbitrary mobile apps and an SDK for integrating the service into web sites using WebRTC.
